head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 26/4/72 ¶ ¶ I am most grateful, dear Mr Guilfoyle, for the additional specimens of Weinmannia lachnocarpa. They prove the constancy of the characters, on which I based the desc...

div.p: RB MSS 439c, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens, Melbourne.
I am most grateful, dear Mr Guilfoyle, for the additional specimens of Weinmannia lachnocarpa. They prove the constancy of the characters, on which I based the description.

I do not know, whether it is asking too much from your generosity to keep in some box pieces of any kind of timber or fuel, that you happen to get under hands and about which you are sure as regards its species. All such material I can utilize for technologic researches. When such pieces of logs &c are kept together and ever a fair opportunity for transit arises, you may kindly send it off.
Pray tell me, whether I can send you any select trees, such as Amer & Himalaian Oaks, Amer. Walnuts, Amer Hickories &c, and if you wish me to direct them to your worthy father

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Various scientific friends ask me for resins & gums, scientifically (specifically) named. Can you help me
